Text.Value: Wyll Ravengard - the stain of Baldur's Gate.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Eltan appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

Text.Value: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.
I should go, gather allies. We'll join you in your hour of need.
You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.
A wyrm? Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?
The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Let it set the path before you.
*Your thoughts come up short.*
He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but as usual he realised the danger before anyone else did.
Do you mean Ansur? He's naught but bones, Eltan. But his spirit has blessed me with power.
Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.
That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you're to bear his legacy, you must release the wyrm.
A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.
He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.
Eltan. I am my father's son. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?
A bronze dragon, to be precise. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.
It will be done. I will seek the wyrm. Together, we will strike down the Absolute.
She lied to you, Eltan. I did everything in my power to get my father to safety!
Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do!
*This woman is no stranger to you - Cordula Eltan, Baldur's Gate patriar and heir to the founder of the Flaming Fist.*
We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.
And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the champion would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be you.
Mizora is a devil - she lied to you. I wanted to save my father, and she sabotaged me.

EditorData.logicalname: Skill_Persuasion - was in IRN, broken pact

Text.Value: Do you mean Ansur? He's dead.
Wyll, there's something you should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.
On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.
Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead, Eltan.

EditorData.logicalname: |Already dealt with Ansur, party did not take helm|

Text.Value: Since then, the city faced countless threats, but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. Until now.
Cordula Eltan? By the Nine Hells, what are you on about?
Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.
Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.
The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.
I have saved countless lives. I am still the man you thought I was.
On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.
I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.
Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.
I will not play your mind games. To arms!
What darkness has fallen upon us.
This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - we need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.

EditorData.stateContext: Eltan and her companions are at ease

Text.Value: Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?
Stand down.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

Text.Value: Well played, Eltan. But you will not stand in my way - the city is mine by rights.
Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. Each of them will soon be put to the test.
Let the dragon sleep. I'll deal with the Absolute on my own terms.
Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.
You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.
Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.
Free the wyrm, let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. May Lady Tymora smile upon you.

EditorData.stateContext: Eltan and company in attack position

Text.Value: Dead? So once more, fortune turns against us.
Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.
I won't have the Hells' errand boy poison Baldur's Gate!
May your father's courage be with you. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.
Probe Eltan's mind.
This is no ordinary dragon.
How you mean to make the city bow to you and you alone.
Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do.
A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.
A wyrm? Why is this the first I'm hearing about this?
Eltan. Mizora is a devil; I am my father's son. Will you really trust her word over mine?
Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead.

EditorData.logicalname: |Already dealt with Ansur, doesn't have helm|

Text.Value: Your faith in me is well-founded. I will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.
Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
Some hero. The Blade of Frontiers, nothing but a cold-blooded killer. I will make him pay for his father's death.
There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.
*You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*
Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.
He understood that if the cult would be successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.
The fate of the city now rests with us.
Find it, and let it set its path before you.

EditorData.stateContext: Eltan and company in attack position

Text.Value: To think your father's blood flows through those damnable veins.

Synopsis: Confrontation with Eltan noble if Ravengard died and Florrick is dead or still in prison.
